intro: Diplotaxis harra, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features basal rosettes of pale green, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom from spring to autumn. Its seeds are small, elongated, and equipped with a pappus for wind dispersal. Diplotaxis harra is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
